title: Local MCP server process management
description:
mcpx manages local MCP server processes alongside its own daemon.

Config:
  servers.playwright.local.command = 'npx'
  servers.playwright.local.args = ['@playwright/mcp@latest', '--port', '8931']

Commands:
  mcpx --daemon        # Starts mcpx + all local servers
  mcpx --daemon-stop   # Stops everything
  mcpx --status        # Show running processes
  mcpx --logs <server> # Tail logs for a managed server

Behavior:
- Remote servers (no local config): just connect
- Local servers (has local config): start process, then connect
- Restart crashed local servers automatically
- Capture stdout/stderr to ~/.mcpx/logs/<server>.log

Future:
- TUI dashboard for status/logs

title: Add --add and --remove commands for server management
description:

title: Support persistent HTTP connections for session-based MCP
description:
Some MCP servers (like Playwright MCP) use 'Streamable HTTP' where session state is tied to the TCP connection.

Current behavior:
- mcpx creates new HTTP connection per request
- Session is lost between calls
- Tools can't be called on these servers

Required:
- Keep HTTP connection alive for session-based servers
- Initialize once, reuse connection for subsequent calls
- Detect session requirement (maybe via server capabilities?)

Affected servers:
- Playwright MCP (confirmed)
- Possibly others using Streamable HTTP transport

Related: mcpx-vb1 (Playwright evaluation)

close_reason: Evaluated - partial compatibility, needs mcpx-cze for full support

comments.author: lakshminp
comments.text:
## Evaluation Complete

**Result: Partial compatibility**

### What works:
- Playwright MCP supports HTTP via --port flag
- Server starts correctly on localhost:8931

### What doesn't work:
- mcpx can't maintain tool calls because Playwright MCP requires persistent connections
- Each mcpx request creates new HTTP connection â†’ session lost
- Error: 'Server not initialized' on tool calls

### Root cause:
Playwright MCP uses 'Streamable HTTP' (session tied to connection)
mcpx uses request/response HTTP (new connection per request)

### Options:
1. Add persistent connection support to mcpx daemon (significant change)
2. Use stdio transport instead (mcpx doesn't support stdio)
3. Document as incompatible until architecture changes

### Recommendation:
Create bead for 'Persistent HTTP connections for session-based MCP servers'
